question: A protocol defines the format and the order of messages exchanged between two communicating entities.
Packets are transmitted over each communication link at a rate equal to the full transmission rate of the link.

In circuit-switched networks, the resources needed along a path to provide for com-munication between the end systems are reserved for the duration of the communication session between the end systems.
The transmission delay has nothing to do with the distance between routers.
Store-and-forward transmission means that the switch must receive the entire packet before it can begin to transmit the first bit of the packet onto the outbound link.
At each layer, a packet has typically two components: header fields and a payload, where the payload is from the layer below.
Bit errors are equally common in wireless links as in wired links.
For a given modulation scheme, the higher the SNR (signal-to-noise ratio), the higher the BER (bit error rate).
HTTP streaming is more widely used than UDP streaming by today’s Internet video streaming applications.

Consider a server (S) and a client (C) connected through a router (R) by two communication links: S – R – C. Let r1 denote the rate of the link between the server and the router, and r2 the rate of the link between the router and the client. Then, the server-to-client throughput is (r1+r2)/2.
In case of a Web application, there are two distinct programs that communicate with each other, namely the Web browser program and the Web server program.
There is no difference between network architecture and application architecture.
HTTP is a stateless protocol.
HTTP and FTP run on top of UDP rather than TCP.
Caching can reduce user-perceived response time.
A company can have the same aliased name for its mail server and for its Web server.
In BitTorrent, if Alice provides chunks to Bob throughout a certain interval, Bob will necessarily return the favor and provide chunks to Alice in this same interval.
In designing a distributed hash table (DHT), there is trade-off between the number of neighbors each peer has to track and the number of messages that the DHT needs to send to resolve a single query.
In a P2P system, when a peer wants to come or leave the system, it must first inform the P2P server.
In a typical client-server application, the server program must be executed before the client program.
A transport-layer protocol can provide reliable data transfer even if the underlying network layer only provides an unreliable service.
Suppose Host A sends one TCP segment with sequence number 30 and 4 bytes of data over a TCP connection to Host B. In this same segment, the acknowledgement number is necessarily 34.
In Go-back-N, the sender is allowed to transmit packets without waiting for an acknowledgement from the receiver.
In TCP, the congestion window at the sender imposes a constraint on the rate at which the TCP sender can send traffic into the network.
When TCP is used, the TCP port number of the destination needs not be the same as the TCP port number of the source.
The size of the TCP announced receive window “rwnd” may change throughout the duration of the connection.

Suppose Host A is sending Host B a large file over a TCP connection. If the sequence number for a segment of this connection is 100, then the sequence number for the subsequent segment will necessarily be 101.
The TCP segment has a field in its protocol header representing the congestion window variable.

Suppose Host A is sending a large file to Host B over a TCP connection. Assume Host B has no data to send Host A. Then, Host B will not send acknowledgements to Host A, because Host B cannot piggyback the acknowledgements on data.
TCP and UDP have the same header size.
A subnet, which has a CIDR address of the form a.b.c.d/25, can accommodate about 128 hosts.
In a virtual circuit (VC) network, a packet keeps the same VC number on each of the links along its route.
Switching in a router forwards data from an input port to an output port.
HOL (head-of-the-line) blocking is a challenge for input queued switches.
All routers only look at the network part and not the host part of the IP address.
Consider a home network connecting to the global Internet via a NAT (network address translation) router. To the global Internet, the NAT router behaves as a single device with a single IP address.
ICMP (Internet control message protocol) messages are carried as IP payload.
IPv6 does not allow for fragmentation and reassembly at intermediate routers.
The distance-vector (DV) routing algorithm is a global routing algorithm.
With the two-dimensional parity check scheme, the receiver can detect and correct a single bit error.
While TDM and FDM assign time slots and frequencies respectively, CDMA assigns a different code to each node.
Checksum methods provide relatively stronger protection against errors as compared to cyclic redundancy check (CRC).
FEC (forward error correction) techniques can increase the number of required sender retransmissions.
Dividing the binary value 10011000 by 1010 gives a remainder of 100.
The maximum efficiency of slotted ALOHA is higher than the maximum efficiency of pure ALOHA.
In the Internet, hosts and routers not only have network-layer addresses but also have link-layer addresses.
In a switch-based Ethernet LAN, there is no need for a MAC protocol.
A switch, which supports VLAN, allows multiple virtual local area networks to be defined over a single physical local area network infrastructure.
MPLS (multiprotocol label switching) networks are circuit-switched in the same manner as time division circuit-switched telephone networks.
